page.title: 02GOOD SHEPHERD CHURCH
page.content: The Good Shepherd Church is in Collier Row Lane. Its entrance is in Redriff Road. The Church was built in 1935. The foundation stone was laid by the Bishop of Chelmsford. 180 people come to 10.30 a.m. service. 210 people come to 2.30 p.m. service. 190 people come between the afternoon and evening service. 50 people come to 6.30 p.m. service. There is a Sunday School split into a climbers and explorers groups. In the week the Church is used for Playgroup, Brownies, Guides, Young Wives, Women's and Men's Groups and Club 11-14. There is an organ, a choir and four chiming bells. 1985 is the Church's 50th Anniversary.
